decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON:  To comply with the provisions of Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:Design and Access Statement; Supporting Document, Electrostatic Precipitator  Technical and Operational Manual; Supporting Document GigaBox centrifugal fan; Odour Management Plan & Ventilation and Impact Statement; Supporting Document  The Commercial Kitchen Filtration Experts; Supporting Document  R02 8 Rectangular Silencer; A100; A101; A102; A103; A104; Supporting Document  Airclean; Supporting Document Pakt
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Condition : 3 - Any plant and machinery, including that for smoke/fume extraction, ventilation, refrigeration and air conditioning, shall be so installed, used and thereafter retained so as to prevent the transmission of noise, vibration and odour/fume into any neighbouring premises.
REASON: In the interests of residential amenity and to meet with the aims of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), policies D3 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Plan (2013).

Condition : 4 - The level of noise emitted from any new plant including that used for ventilation, refrigeration, air conditioning and fume extraction shall be lower than the existing background level by at least 10LpA. Noise levels shall be determined at one meter from the window of the nearest noise sensitive premises. The back ground noise level shall be expressed as the lowest LA 90 (10 minutes) during which plant is or may be in operation.  Prior to the first use of any new plant, a Noise Report shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing to demonstrate compliance.  The plant shall be retained in accordance with the approved details.
REASON: In the interests of residential amenity and to meet with the aims of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), policies D3 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Plan (2013).

Condition : 5 - The use hereby permitted shall not be open to customers outside of the following hours unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority:
Monday to Thursday 08:00am to 09:30pm
Sunday and Bank Holidays 09:00am- 9:00pm
Friday and Saturday 08:00am to 10:00pm
REASON: In the interests of residential amenity and to meet with the aims of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Plan (2013).

Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby permitted details of 2 long stay secure cycle parking spaces in accordance with London Plan (2021) standards shall be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The cycle parking spaces shall be constructed on site in accordance with the approved details and thereafter be retained.
REASON: To promote sustainable transport in accordance with policy T5 of The London Plan (2021).

Condition : 7 - The ventilation unit/duct work shall be interlocked with a carbon monoxide monitor, be surrounded by silencers and have in built secondary and adequate filters to reduce odour/smell.
REASON: In the interests of residential amenity and to meet with the aims of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), policies D3 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), and Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Plan (2013).

Condition : 8 - Prior to the first use of the development hereby permitted, details of waste and recycling facilities for the proposed use shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval in writing.  The development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details and thereafter be retained.
REASON: To ensure adequate standards of hygiene and refuse/waste collection without prejudice to the enjoyment by neighbouring occupiers of their properties in accordance with policy DM 44 and DM 45 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Plan (2013).
